DOC.brief_title: Insulin Differences Between African-American Caucasian Female Adolescents With Polycystic Ovary Syndrome ( PCOS )
DOC.detailed_description: PCOS common endocrine abnormality reproductive-aged woman United States , affect approximately 5 million woman ( 1 ) . The exact prevalence PCOS adolescent population unknown mainly attribute diagnostic challenge PCOS present characteristic normal puberty overlap sign symptom PCOS ( 2 ) . The key feature PCOS include menstrual irregularity , hyper¬androgenism , polycystic ovarian morphology ultrasound . However , clinical presentation may vary . It complex heterogeneous condition life-long psychological , reproductive , metabolic manifestation impact woman 's health throughout lifespan . PCOS associate major metabolic consequence include hyperinsulinism ( i.e . increase insulin secretion ) , insulin resistance ( i.e . decrease insulin sensitivity ) , obesity , type 2 diabetes mellitus , dyslipidemia , cardiovascular disease , endothelial dysfunction , defective fibrino¬lysis , well endometrial carcinoma ( 3 ) . Particular disease process show predilection certain racial ethnic group . African-American [ AA ] adult increase risk obesity , type 2 diabetes mellitus , cardiovascular disease mortality , hyper¬tension compare Caucasian [ CA ] adult . Past study ( 4-9 ) find AAs increase insulin secretion decrease insulin sensitivity compare CA counterpart adolescence adulthood even childhood . These finding secondary combination increase insulin secretion resistance decrease insulin sensitivity clearance note African-Americans . It combination alter glucose metabolism place AAs increase risk cardiovascular metabolic morbidity . It propose hyperinsulinism increase insulin secretion compensatory response pancreatic β-cell increase insulin resistance . However , also speculate insulin resistance compensatory response occur response insulin hyper-secretion cause pancreatic β-cell dysregulation ( 10-11 ) . Hyperinsulinism insulin resistance know inherent feature PCOS . Several study demonstrate significant hyperinsulinism insulin resistance lower insulin sensitivity adolescent adult PCOS compare BMI-matched healthy control subject ( 12-18 ) . Marked difference insulin sensitivity/resistance PCOS phenotype report adult different races/ethnicities PCOS ( 19-23 ) , however ; study refute claim ( 24-27 ) . The objective study examine difference insulin secretion AA CA adolescent PCOS . We also examine difference insulin sensitivity/resistance AA CA adolescent PCOS . Primary Aim : To determine influence racial/ethnic background insulin secretion adolescent female PCOS . Secondary Aim : To determine influence racial/ethnic background insulin sensitivity/resistance adolescent female PCOS . Hypothesis : AA adolescent female PCOS increase insulin secretion decrease insulin sensitivity ( i.e . increase insulin resistance ) compare CA adolescent female PCOS . To address hypothesis , utilize one gold standard endorse American Diabetes Association satisfactorily assess insulin secretion insulin sensitivity/resistance . The method utilized study frequently sample intravenous glucose tolerance test minimal model analysis ( MINMOD FSIVGTT ) ( 28-32 ) . Using data gather part primary secondary aim , also conduct exploratory analysis examine influence PCOS phenotype insulin secretion insulin sensitivity/resistance influence racial/ethnic background PCOS phenotype .
DOC.criteria: Children adolescent age 1218 year AfricanAmerican Caucasian female Menarchal least 2 year Hemoglobin A1C < 6.5 % Medical Condition : Polycystic Ovary Syndrome ( PCOS ) base AES criterion : HA addition ANOV and/or PCO Hyperandrogenism ( require ) : Serum Testosterone > 50 ng/dl Free Testosterone ( % ) > 1.4 % Free Testosterone > 7 pg/mL Oligo and/or Anovulation : menstrual cycle length > 35 day and/or < 8 menstrual cycle year Polycystic Ovaries : transabdominal transvaginal ultrasound find 12 follicle measure 26 mm diameter increase ovarian volume ( > 10 mL ) Medications : Medicationnaive treatment therapy Metformin , Oral Contraceptives , Antiandrogen medication Ages < 12 > 18 Prepubertal , Premenarche Hemoglobin A1C ≥6.5 % Medical Conditions : Hypothyroidism , Hyperthyroidism , Diabetes Mellitus , Congenital Adrenal Hyperplasia , Hyperprolactinemia , Pregnancy Medications : Past and/or Present treatment therapy Metformin , Oral Contraceptives , Antiandrogen medication , Insulin oral hypoglycemic agent
